label: Description
value: Yellow horizontally ribbed ground.  Large-scale polychrome silk embroidered design of flowers, fruit, ornamental rococo scrolls, and architectural motifs. Trimmed with silver galloon. Backed with red linen. Front composed of a number of small pieces. Made of material from 18th century France.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk; metal thread; linen Technique: embroidered

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Frederick W. Vanderbilt

label: Description
value: White horizontally ribbed ground. Traces of vertical stripe in extra warp, but nearly worn away. Brocaded design in pink, tan, green, yellow, blue, and silver metallic thread. Design shows large drooping branch with flower heads and two curving trees, a pond and rustic fence in the background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: compound weave with supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Drawn after a plastic cast. Shown obliquely from the right front corner.

label: Description
value: Fragment shows a man and woman seated on the ground next to a stream with plants. A dog lies in front of them. They float against a background pattern of overlapping ovals. The words "Estelle et Nemorin" appear within the leafy vegetation.

label: Description
value: Fragment shows a figure representing America standing before two figures representing France. An angel on a cloud floats above playing a trumpet. On the ground is a horse looking in the direction of the angel. The bodies sit on foliage.
